html:
2.23.19  8:48 pm   how do you not lose motivation?

     never quite get what i want

2.23.19  8:08 pm   I am so fucking lonely that even having friends family lovers acquaintances etc. doesn't help me anymore. That doesn't make any logical sense. That's like saying you're so hungry that eating food doesn't help anymore. Should I resign myself to the fact that my internal lonely-logic is broken and try to make a poem about it or some shit? I feel like a broken watering can put singlehandedly in charge of saving a rainforest that got teleported to the desert the moment I was born. or something fffffgdgdgdgdgkshgkshg Wait why am I typing this in a question box to the website of a total stranger, I should be writing this down. I don't feel like I make any more sense but thanks for having this text box where I can try. P.S. it's 8pm and I'm just now realizing I forgot to brush my teeth this morning because I was busy trying to figure out how to be okay with asonance instead of rhyming sometimes, why am I like this hhhhhhhhhh P.P.S. your latest video was fucking *fire emoji*

     sounds like you are on the right track

2.23.19  6:09 pm   Why don't you put some rad guitar solos in your songs?

     i don't have an actual guitar soloist but i have often created similar sections via keyboard solo

2.23.19  5:03 pm   where did you get that helm you're wearing in "when i get older"

     i don't recall wearing one

2.23.19  4:42 pm   i heard you say in an interview recently that prior to maybe 2014 or so you didn't have a schedule and nothing got done.

     i would be curious to see a citation for that because that is quite untrue

      I can identify with that in a way. I feel like I'm always wanting to write these grand opuses out of my ideas, treating them like they have boundless potential and that I should only see them through to their maximum potential while also wanting spend time getting better at my instruments, spend time listening to other people/learning, going to work etc. and i slowly chip away at everything but nothing gets done. I may have fear of letting go of the attachment to my ideas and wanting to make them so grand. Did you have any hard time transitioning from not having a schedule to having a schedule? Did you have to set yourself time limits or alarms to remember to do certain things and move on to the next? Has having the schedule made you not just more productive in general as a result of it, but gradually increased your capacity to be more productive over time of consistently adhering to it?

      ah, you must complete the 12 levels of suffering, then the 13th which is the unlucky last and final level; the reason it is unlucky is because after you finish it you will be informed that there is another level after that

2.23.19  3:54 pm   Whenever I'm rejected for something (job, date, hanging out, etc) I have a complete breakdown and lay in my bed and cry for days. How do I stop? 

     start looking forward to becoming more succesful so that you can eventually reject them in the future

2.23.19  3:48 pm   is writing music equivalent to telling a story?

     stories can be used in music, and music can be used in stories

2.23.19  3:15 pm   I noticed that in most of your songs (especially Just Did A Bad Thing), you use instruments to emphasize your voice during singing.

     sure

      Is this a conscious choice? And if so, what is your goal by doing it?

     to score

2.23.19  2:24 pm   My question is how do I question a question?

     why would you want to do that

2.23.19  2:13 pm   how the hell do you make a melody

     it's a lot like making a baby, which i don't know how to do either

2.23.19  2:12 pm   are you insane

     i have that skill set

2.23.19  2:00 pm   What is the downside of being yourself?

     i'm not anyone else

2.23.19  12:46 pm   when is the time?

     any moment now

2.23.19  12:25 pm   It makes me sad how hard critics panned Weezer's cover album, I wish they would've just chilled out and enjoyed the fun. How will your approach differ when you start doing covers?

     hopefully do it more funly

2.23.19  12:07 pm   what do you think about indian music?

     to find that out i would have to know which music is indian, and that much i do not know

2.23.19  11:45 am   do you think humans will ever find a way out of here(the time and space) before it gets destroyed?

     yes

2.23.19  11:40 am   do you think bread tastes good? i think bread tastes good, but i want to hear someoene else's opinion, in case i am incorrect or mistaken

     it feels good

2.23.19  10:06 am   if you are listening to a song and the singer hits a certain note but they are, say, 10-20 or 30-40 ct. off, is that noticeable to you? And does that annoy you etc.

     you can be annoying or unannoying at any pitch. different people may even disagree on what they are annoyed by

2.23.19  10:03 am   hey stupid, get your Self together!

     o k

2.23.19  9:51 am   you're in good shape, because at a certain age you know you know

     it's interesting, i don't know who these people are

2.23.19  7:19 am   In what key is the main Harry Potter theme by John Williams? Has a lot of notes right next to each otherthere's even that part that's like nanananananaNANAnaNANANANA that's 3 notes right next to each other

     i have never heard it but after listening to this version: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pf-8WMI-7J4 (the first version i found), for at least the first 40 seconds, despite a bit of adventurousness, E minor is unquestionably the home key for at least that far

2.23.19  6:35 am   will there be any improv playing in the live

     yes

2.23.19  6:01 am   tips on coping with existensial crisis?

     have a second one at the same time

2.23.19  4:46 am   ive realised that while you say quite a lot you also say incredibly little. would you agree with this statement?

     yes and no

     can you explain why you do this?

     it's good to explore all the different possible amounts to say. that way you can live a full and fruitful life, without feeling like you have missed out on anything

2.23.19  3:40 am   i remember once during an enforced choir class (that everyone had to take if they were part of the music program) there was a guitar player who was super talented but he just couldnt sing at all. Teacher kept asking him to sing higher and he just sing louder hahaha, not sure if that was the face he made from frustrtion from the throat-ear disconnect, or from the confusion of his voice not sounding like the timbre of the piano so it being harder to try and imagine what that pitch would soung like in voice.. it was a nice transformaion to hear him sing later on, it was just something he never tried hard enough to break out of his knowledge/skill comfot zone. Do you have any tips for breaking as many walls as you can daily? Things we may never know we could learn unless we tried doing them. Do you think this is part of what it's all about, or it's a distraction from getting better in your field?  would they all help you in your field somehow? sounds l ike a multi-armed bandit situation, i want a marshmellow now instead of 10 later

     breaking through walls is fun but i think breaking multiple walls every single day might get a little dicey at some point

2.23.19  3:35 am   Salad or bannanas?

     i wonder if you can combine the 2 somehow

2.23.19  3:31 am   2.21.19  1:21 pm do you mean a distraction from it, or a distraction from enjoyment/outoftuneness in music?by "a perfect sense of pitch",

     sure yea

      do you mean being able to match a tone? wether by tuning a guitar or being able to sing a long to a tone etc, or is it something different you speak of?

     i was talking about how absolute pitch is commonly called 'perfect pitch' but i think it's misleading to call it that because that makes it sound like it means you are great with pitches, but absolute pitch is not quite that, it's actually a very specific skill where you can name the absolute frequency of notes, but it has nothing to do any notes' relation to each other. notes' relationships to each other is where 99% of the music happens. and it's possible to have wizard-like absolute pitch and still have no clue where to find the birthday song or jingle bells

2.23.19  3:21 am   obviously you have the magical powers imbued by the use of music and video but i think you may also have access to something else. maybe a kind of reifying charisma? a will-manifestation zap? every time i see or listen to your hope you have a good day song, suddenly it has been a good day, just because i heard you hoped it. 

     that could be useful

2.23.19  12:10 am   I'm trying to get ahead in Business. Honestly. It's so hard, even if you are very good. What should I do?

     happen upon some hard times, or at least slightly harder times than you are used to

2.23.19  12:06 am   Is Bruce Horsnby your Dad?

     perhaps my god-sister in law

2.22.19  11:51 pm   in this video you look like you didn't really know what to do so you just looked around and grabbed what looked like something you could incorporate into the video. is this what was going on

     yes

      or did you already know what you were going to do https://www.instagram.com/p/BbBkq37AN43/

     i knew that a certain portion of music video performance should include improvised prop decisions. you can pretty much count on that

2.22.19  10:50 pm   Do u remember the moment that ur dreams were broken

     yes

2.22.19  10:38 pm   Hey Bill. One of my music teachers said that a good way to learn how to play a difficult song is to learn every measure, measure by measure, backwards. That way as you play, you go from less to more familiar measures as you play, rather than play things you know and on the way forget how to do the new stuff you just learned. What do you think about this method?

     that makes sense

2.22.19  10:33 pm   Your answers are often kinda philosophical. Would you call yourself a philosophical person?

     i prefer to just stick to 1 name, and then make as much different content as i can, not telling anyone which piece of content is less or more quintessential than the others. this is likely a reflection of the way it seems the universe has treated me

2.22.19  10:08 pm   how can I assure that I won't be a complete failure in the near future?

     you could try being a partial failure

2.22.19  9:52 pm   help me i am a human

     try stories

2.22.19  9:28 pm   wouldn't it be awesome if everyone did art or some form of self-expression?

     everyone might be best at different things

     is that one of the reasons why you do it

     i try to do what's right for me as much as i can

2.22.19  9:21 pm   do you play every instrument accurately in your music videos?

     as much as possible

      why?

     properly synchronized music videos are much much more exciting and compelling to watch, even for the least expert viewers. it makes an enormous difference as to how hard the video hits. especially rhythmic accuracy

2.22.19  9:17 pm   at which moment do you write arrangements, the exact bass voicings, and so on?

     during the recording process

      is it all decided before production?

     the road map, exact melody/lyric/chords, and tempo, are established before recording. and maybe some other relevant details akin to what you might see in script notes. (alex appears to be kind of angry when reading the next line, etc). and then in production it would be up to the director as to exactly how to accomplish what the writing calls for

2.22.19  8:56 pm   What's your favorite Bill Wurtz song?

     i would prefer to make a new one to be my favorite

2.22.19  8:41 pm   What is wrong with this

     doesn't say what this is

2.22.19  8:37 pm   Have you found a way to write songs with a form yet?

     yes

2.22.19  7:24 pm   what is the most challenging part of being you? 

     i don't get to be you

2.22.19  7:04 pm   The only question I have regarding Mount St. Helens is about to Blow Up is how do you know that hell isn't green and gold? 

     i don't know

2.22.19  6:53 pm   how can i succeed at becoming successful?

     fail at failing

2.22.19  6:36 pm   Why do I keep thinking about all the stupid things I have done so much?

     perhaps you want to savour the memory of stupidness, for good old times sake, before moving onto something more smart

2.22.19  6:27 pm   is the world getting sadder?

     yes, and happier

2.22.19  6:26 pm   what genre are you?

     i am an esoteric blend of typical, average, ordinary, and normal

2.22.19  6:25 pm   Why do people say things are written in the stars,,, stars can't write?

     i think it means it was written in the same way the stars were

2.22.19  6:25 pm   2.21.19  7:03 pm do you think you'd say that your content is (at least partially) an exploration of the nature of good?

     that turns into a massive neverending series of riddles, but yes

      i feel like i do that when i make stuff, trying to figure out what it means for something to be good, rather than trying to express myself or make a statement or whatever else people usually do art for (not that they are in opposition to exploring good, only that they aren't my primary drives), and i'm unsure if anyone else has that experience or not

     seems like a reasonable scientific pursuit to find what's good. i've heard very good things about good. good has a good reputation
